abstract: Annual News Corporation shareholders meeting is expected to be most contentious in years, as frustrated investors prepare to demand accountability for phone hacking scandal that has embarrassed company; investors will also have a chance to vote on company's board members, including Rupert Murdoch and his sons James and Lachlan.
snippet: A shareholders meeting on Friday in Los Angeles is expected to be heated, with investors demanding accountability after a phone-hacking scandal deeply embarrassed the company.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods

lead_paragraph: A shareholders meeting on Friday in Los Angeles is expected to be heated, with investors demanding accountability after a phone-hacking scandal deeply embarrassed the company.

headline.main: Irate News Corp. Shareholders to Take Murdoch to the Woodshed
headline.print_headline: Irate News Corp. Shareholders to Take Murdoch to the Woodshed
